Population: a | A branch of the Ayyubid dynasty ruled Hisn Kayfa until the early 16th century. | b | For details of the languages spoken by the Ayyubid rulers and their subjects, see § Religion, ethnicity and language below. | c | The total population of the Ayyubid territories is unknown. This population figure only includes Egypt, Syria, Upper Mesopotamia, Palestine and Transjordan. Other Ayyubid territories, including coastal areas of Yemen, the Hejaz, Nubia and Cyrenaica are not included.
